The Prime Minister, on behalf of his colleagues, extendeda warm welcome to Field-Marshal Smuts. It was their hope thaton this occasion he would be able to make a longer stay in thiscountry; and they looked forward greatly to his help and adviceat their Meetings.Parliament.K.ing's speeches on prorogation and Opening ofParliament.(previous reference:W.M. (42).143rdConclusions,Minute 4.)2. The War Cabinet invited a Committee consisting of The Lord President of the Council (in the Chair),The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs,The Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs,The Secretary of State for Air,The Minister of Labour and National Service,The President of the Board of Education,to prepare and submit to the War Cabinet a draft of The King'speeches on the Prorogation and Opening of Parliament.Parliament. 3. The Joint Parliamentary Secretary to the Treasury saidDate of that it was now proposed that Parliament, after reassembling on prorogation and Tuesday, the 12th October, should sit for five weeks until Thursday,Opening of the ILth November, to deal, inter alia, with the Wage Earners'Parliament. Income Tax Bill, the Electoral Machinery Bill and the prolongation-tion of Parliament Bill; that it should then adjourn for a week andshould meet again on Tuesday, the 23rd November, for Proroga-tion. The new Session would be opened on Wednesday, the24th November.The War Cabinet-Approved these arrangements.Anglo-Soviet-ArnericanConference.(previous reference:W.M.
